faq.globalSearchTitle: How to search for an article in the warehouse?
faq.globalSearchContent: To search for an article, enter its ID into the search bar on the main page and press the 'Search' button. The system will display the rack, shelf number, store, status, and quantity where the article is located. This system is designed for quick retrieval of articles within warehouse procedures.
faq.barcodeScannerTitle: How to use the barcode scanner?
faq.barcodeScannerContent: On the 'Scan Barcode' page, you can use your device's camera to scan an article's barcode. After a successful scan, you will be redirected to the main page with the search results for that article. Ensure you have granted camera access.
faq.massAddArticlesContent: On the 'Mass Add Articles' page, first lock the shelf details (rack, shelf number, store) where you want to add articles. Then, you can scan or manually enter article IDs and their quantities. All added articles will be saved to a list, and you can save them to the system in bulk. This function is ideal for quick stocking.
faq.articleManagementContent: On the 'Article Management' page, you can add new articles, edit their details (name, rack, shelf, store, status, quantity, min. quantity), or delete existing articles. You can also generate and print barcodes for articles. For administrators, there is also an option to manage global articles.
faq.rackManagementContent: On the 'Rack Management' page, you can add new racks, edit their rows, numbers, and shelf descriptions, or delete existing racks. Each rack must be assigned to a store. This function helps maintain an overview of storage locations.
faq.changePasswordContent: You can change your password on the 'Account Settings' page in the 'Security' section. Enter your current password, then your new password twice. For security, we recommend using strong passwords with a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.
faq.themeLanguageTitle: How to change the theme and language?
faq.themeLanguageContent: You can change the application theme (light, dark, system) and interface language using the toggles in the application header or in the mobile menu. Changes will take effect immediately.
faq.externalLinksTitle: How to access external links (MyJYSK, StoreFront)?
faq.externalLinksContent: On the main page and login page, you will find buttons for quick access to MyJYSK and StoreFront. Clicking them will open the external website in an overlay window, so you don't have to leave the application.
faq.lowStockAlertsContent: Low stock alerts are displayed on the main page if an article's quantity in a specific store falls below its set minimum quantity. These alerts help you quickly identify articles that need to be replenished.
faq.barcodeGeneratorTitle: How to generate and print barcodes?
faq.barcodeGeneratorContent: On the 'Article Management' page, you can click the QR code icon next to each article. A dialog will open where you can view the generated barcode and print it. This is useful for labeling goods or storage locations.

adminFaq.adminTutorialsDescription: Here you will find detailed tutorials for managing the JYSK WMS system.
adminFaq.siteDashboardOverviewContent: On the main administration page, you see an overview of key statistics: total number of stores, users, articles, and racks in the system. This information provides you with a quick glance at the overall status and scope of data in the application.
adminFaq.storeManagementContent: In the 'Store Management' section, you can add new stores by entering their ID and name. When adding a new store, you have the option to automatically add default articles. You can also edit the names of existing stores or delete them. Deleting a store is irreversible and will remove all associated articles and racks.
adminFaq.userManagementContent: In the 'User Management' section, you can create new user accounts, edit existing users, and delete them. When creating or editing a user, you can set their role (e.g., 'admin', 'warehouse_manager', 'warehouse_worker') and assign specific permissions. Ensure each user has the correct store assigned (if not an administrator).
adminFaq.globalArticleManagementContent: As an administrator, you have access to 'Global Article Management' on the 'Article Management' page. Here you can define and manage default articles that can be automatically added to new stores. You can add, edit, and delete these global articles, including their ID, name, status, and minimum quantity.
adminFaq.helpPostManagementContent: In the 'Help Article Management' section, you can create, edit, and delete articles that appear in the 'Help Center' for all users. Each article has an ID, title, content, category, and keywords for easy searching. Keep the help content up-to-date and clear.
adminFaq.logViewerContent: In the 'Activity Log', you can monitor all important system events, such as logins, logouts, adding/editing/deleting articles, racks, and users. You can filter records by activity type, user, or store, and also clear the entire log. This is crucial for auditing and troubleshooting.
adminFaq.exportDataContent: On the 'Export Data' page, you can select which types of data (users, stores, articles, racks) you want to export. You can choose between CSV and JSON formats. Exported data will be downloaded to your device. This function is useful for backing up or analyzing data.
adminFaq.copyArticlesContent: In the 'Store Management' section, you will find a 'Copy Articles' button. This function allows you to copy all articles from one 'source' store to another 'target' store. You can also choose whether to overwrite existing articles in the target store. This is very useful for quickly setting up inventory in new stores or for data synchronization.
